meanings.definition: A small group of people working together for a common purpose.
meanings.sent1: During the school project, our squads collaborated to finish the task.
meanings.sent2: The volunteer squads cleaned up the park together.
meanings.sent3: The squads of friends decided to bake cookies for their neighbors.
meanings.sent4: In the game, the squads of players strategically planned their moves.
meanings.sent5: The squads of ants worked tirelessly to build their anthill.

meanings.definition: A unit of police officers or soldiers trained to work together.
meanings.sent1: The police squads patrolled the neighborhood to ensure safety.
meanings.sent2: The military squads conducted a training exercise in the field.
meanings.sent3: The squads of officers organized a charity event for the community.
meanings.sent4: The soldier squads marched in perfect formation during the parade.
meanings.sent5: The SWAT squads swiftly responded to the emergency situation.
